caption:
This photograph features a vibrant urban scene, possibly from a city's downtown area. The focus of the image is on a large red brick tower with a clock, prominently displaying the time. On the tower, there is a sign with the text "GO BY TRAIN" and "UNION STATION," indicating that this is likely a historic or central train station.

The foreground shows a busy street lined with vehicles typical of a late 20th-century setting. Cars are seen parked along the side of the street, and there is also some distant traffic. Street signs and traffic lights are visible, enhancing the urban feel.

The background includes other buildings with varying architectural styles and a distinct sky that is clear and blue, suggesting the photograph was taken on a sunny day.

Street lamps are aligned along the sidewalk, and there are minimal pedestrians visible, focusing the viewer's attention more on the architecture and the station's tower. Additionally, some greenery is visible, which adds a touch of nature to the urban environment.

Overall, the composition captures a slice of city life centered around a significant public transportation hub.
title: Union-station in Portland, Oregon, one of 450 passenger train terminals serviced by amtrak in 1974.  During that year the corporation listed 8,800 employees and operated 225 trains per day.  A steady decline in ridership from the end of world war ii to 1970 has been reversed since amtrak assumed responsibility for most u.s intercity rail passenger service.  A total of 14.5 million passengers rode the rails in 1973
